Detailed Description

Layer Class.

The DynLayer provides the basic functionality to control DHTML elements. Other higher-level objects use many DynLayers which interact with each other and control their events to create larger "widgets". The DynLayer is the single most important object in the DynAPI.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

DynLayer::DynLayer ( string id,
int x,
int y,
int w,
int h,
string bgColor,
string visible,
int zIndex,
string bgImage )
 

Creates a new DynLayer object with the given parameters.

All parameters are optional. A unique layer id will be created if no id is given.

Example Usage: 

 mylayer = new DynLayer();

Member Function Documentation

void DynLayer::EventMethod ( ) [private]
 

void DynLayer::addChild ( DynLayer dlyr )
 

Adds the given DynLayer(s) to this DynLayer.

Note:
Once a layer has been added to a document, it may not be added again. You must use removeChild first.

void DynLayer::addChildID ( DynLayer child ) [private]
 

void DynLayer::addEventListener ( EventListener listener )
 

Adds the EventListener to the DynLayer.

Example Usage: 

 var x = new EventListener(mylayer);
 mylayer.addEventListner(x);

object DynLayer::getClass ( ) [private]
 

Returns DynLayer constructor object.

Example Usage: 

 if (mylayer.getClass() == DynLayer) {
 // mylayer is a dynlayer
 }

int DynLayer::getClip ( )

false   layer is hidden

void DynLayer::setStyle ( object style )
 

Sets the DynLayer styles.

Object properties that can be set are: style.id style.left style.width style.height style.backgroundImage style.backgroundColor style.visibility style.zIndex;

Example Usage: 

 var style = new Object();
 style.left = 4
 style.height = 11
 mylayer.getStyle(style);

void DynLayer::setVisible ( boolean visible )
 

Sets the DynLayer visible.

Parameters:
true   shows the layer and false hides the layer

boolean noevt )

If noevt is false, then no event is fired
